qas.question: What are some of the minor sports in the United Kingdom?
What is the most popular sport in the United Kingdom?
How many national Ruby teams are there in the United Kingdom?
In which hemisphere do the rugby playing countries meet once every four years?
How often do the national rugby teams play for the Triple Crown?
Beginning in 2011, teams of which countries compete in the RaboDirect Pro12?
Since what year have teams from Ireland, Scotland, Wales and Italy been competing in the Rugby Pro12 league?
As part of the Seven Nations Championship, which rugby teams play for the Triple Crown each year?
Rugby union is widely disliked where?

context: Many globally popular sports had modern rules codified in the British Isles, including golf, association football, cricket, rugby, snooker and darts, as well as many minor sports such as <a0_0>croquet, bowls, pitch and putt<a0_0/>, water polo and handball. A number of sports are popular throughout the British Isles, the most prominent of which is <a1_0>association football<a1_0/>. While this is organised separately in different national associations, leagues and national teams, even within the UK, it is a common passion in all parts of the islands. Rugby union is also widely enjoyed across the islands with <a2_0>four<a2_0/> national teams from <b8_0>England, Ireland, Scotland and Wales.<b8_0/> The British and Irish Lions is a team chosen from each national team and undertakes tours of the <a3_0>southern hemisphere<a3_0/> rugby playing nations every four years. Ireland play as a united team, represented by players from both Northern Ireland and the Republic. These <b7_0>national rugby teams<b7_0/> play each other <a4_0>each year<a4_0/> for the Triple Crown as part of the Six Nations Championship. Also since <b6_0>2001<b6_0/> the professional club teams of <b5_0>Ireland, Scotland, Wales and Italy<b5_0/> compete against each other in the RaboDirect Pro12.
